Description: Upper body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: lower part of band of tongues, one with traces of added red; below, black-figure decoration consisting of male figure (only lower body missing; right arm outstreched and left arm behind him and with red on neck and chest) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.201.1894.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 31)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 265, no. B192)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0948)
